H0.text: Earthquakes are the most likely event that occurs as a result of crustal movement along transform boundaries.

H1.text: Volcanic activity is the event that most likely takes place as the result of crustal movement along transform boundaries.

H2.text: Mountain building is the event most likely to take place as a result of crustal movement along transform boundaries.

H3.text: Trenches are the event that most likely takes place as the result of crustal movement along transform boundaries.

A4.text: Transform boundaries are also known as conservative plate boundaries because they involve no addition or loss of lithosphere at the Earth's surface.

A5.text: Leaky transform fault â€“ Transform fault producing new crust

A6.text: Strike-slip faults, particularly continental transforms, can produce major earthquakes up to about magnitude 8.

A7.text: Reverse faults occur in areas where the crust is being shortened such as at a convergent boundary.
